newsitem.title: USA: Integrated Systems sees weak Q4 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Integrated Systems sees weak Q4 earnings.

text.p: Integrated Systems Inc said Monday it expects its fourth quarter and fiscal 1997 earnings will fall short of analysts' expectations.

The company said in a statement it expects primary earnings per share for the fourth quarter of between $0.10 and $0.11 per share. Earnings per share for the full year are estimated to be between $0.31 and $0.32, including merger related expenses.
Excluding the merger related expenses, primary earnings per share for the year would be $0.46 to $0.47.
Analysts expected the company would earn $0.19 a share for the fourth quarter and $0.55 a share for the year.
The company will release its results after the close of the market on March 26.
